subject: Relationships
title: Dunbar's Number: The Friendship Limit
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Dunbar's Number: The Friendship Limit.

hook.text: You can't have 1,000 real friends. Your brain literally doesn't have the capacity. The limit is about 150.

buildup.text: Robin Dunbar found that the human neocortex limits stable social relationships to roughly 150 people.

discovery.text: Within that 150: about 5 intimate friends, 15 close friends, 50 good friends, and 150 casual connections.

twist.text: Social media inflates our friend count while shrinking our inner circle. 5,000 followers; 3 real friends.

climax.text: Your brain has a budget for friendship. Spending it wisely matters more than growing the number.

punchline.text: Your brain caps real friendships at about 150. Quality beats quantity.
